alert.note: Alert for Elbert (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 03 at 2:34PM EST until January 06 at 8:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by recent heavy rainfall over the basin and in upstream areas. * WHERE...The Beaverdam Creek channel in Elbert County in northeast Georgia. * WHEN...Until 430 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 229 PM EST, Gauge reports indicated that heavy rainfall of 1 to 3 inches fell over the basin or in upstream areas over the past 24 hours. This upstream water working southward through the Beaverdam Creek channel will permit minor flooding to develop or continue through late afternoon. - Beaverdam Creek is exceeding its banks and flooding low-lying areas adjacent to the stream. This includes areas near Brewers Bridge Road, Winns Mill Road, Brickyard Road, and Horse Farm Road. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
